gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.hibernate
Class HibernateSessionProviderImpl

java.lang.Object
  JdbcConnectionProviderImpl
      gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.hibernate.HibernateSessionProviderImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
HibernateSessionProvider
public class HibernateSessionProviderImpl
extends JdbcConnectionProviderImpl
implements HibernateSessionProvider

Implementation ofHibernateSessionProvider that will load a hibernate.cfg.xml and a set of hibernate mapping files and will create a static SessionFactory in order to provide Sessions. The Session is passed a Jdbc Connection. Information about the driver, the connection, and hibernate configuration and mappings is provided in a properties object. Note that the supplied hibernate.cfg.xml does not need to provide connection related properties (e.g. connection.driver_class, connection.url, connection.username, connection.password). This is the first class that is loaded for Bo2 hibernate support. Any initialization of Bo2 necessary for Hibernate must take place here.

unregister

public void unregister(java.lang.Object object)
Description copied from interface: HibernateSessionProvider
Deletes from this provider's register an object.
This method unregisters object that had previously been registered with register(object). The most common use for this method is after the deletion of persistent objects.

setExcluded

public void setExcluded(java.lang.Object object)
Description copied from interface: HibernateSessionProvider
Marks an object as being excluded from flushing. This method is meaningless unless this provider's flushing policy is set to FlushStrategy.EXCLUDING.

Specified by:
setExcluded in interface HibernateSessionProvider
Parameters:
object - Object to exclude from this provider's session flushing.

setNotExcluded

public void setNotExcluded(java.lang.Object object)
Description copied from interface: HibernateSessionProvider
Cancels the exclusion of an object from the session flushing. This method should be used for objects that have been marked for exclusion from flush, with setExcluded(object). Calling this method makes sense only when this provider's flushing policy is set to FlushStrategy.EXCLUDING.

Specified by:
setNotExcluded in interface HibernateSessionProvider
Parameters:
object - Object to exclude from this provider's session flushing.
See Also:
HibernateSessionProvider.setExcluded(Object)

setFlushStrategy

public void setFlushStrategy(FlushStrategy flushStrategy)
Description copied from interface: HibernateSessionProvider
Sets the flush strategy of this provider. The flush strategy specifies the behavior of this provider's flush(object) method. Setting the flushing strategy should be done with caution in order not to degrade performance.

Specified by:
setFlushStrategy in interface HibernateSessionProvider
Parameters:
flushStrategy - The flushStrategy to set.
